title.value: Linking functional and structural brain organisation with behaviour in autism: a multimodal EU‑AIMS Longitudinal European Autism Project (LEAP) study
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote:
Linking functional and structural brain
organisation with behaviour in autism:
a multimodal EU‑AIMS Longitudinal European
Autism Project (LEAP) study

extractions.description: This research paper investigates the associations between brain structure, functional connectivity, and behavior in autistic and non-autistic individuals using MRI data from multiple time points. The study utilizes advanced multimodal integration techniques to identify phenotypes associated with autism and explores how these phenotypes relate to behavioral measures.

type.justification: The study involves data collection, analysis, and interpretation based on multimodal MRI, behavioral, and clinical data from participants.
type.quote: Neuroimaging analyses of brain structure and function in autism have typically been conducted in isolation, missing the sensitivity gains of linking data across modalities. Here we focus on the integration of structural and functional organisational properties of brain regions. We aim to identify novel brain-organisation phenotypes of autism.

name.justification: The primary research field is Neuroscience as the study investigates brain structure and functional connectivity using neuroimaging techniques.
name.quote: Neuroimaging analyses of brain structure and function in autism have typically been conducted in isolation, missing the sensitivity gains of linking data across modalities.

name.justification: The study focuses on neuroimaging techniques such as MRI to investigate brain organization.
name.quote: We utilised multimodal MRI (T1-, diffusion-weighted and resting state functional)...

name.justification: The study specifically investigates autism, its brain phenotypes, and behavioral associations.
name.quote: We aim to identify novel brain-organisation phenotypes of autism.

name.justification: The dataset comes from the EU-AIMS Longitudinal European Autism Project (LEAP), as directly stated in the paper.
name.quote: We utilised multimodal MRI (T1-, diffusion-weighted and resting state functional), behavioural and clinical data from the EU AIMS Longitudinal European Autism Project (LEAP).

referenced_paper_title.value: The EU-AIMS Longitudinal European Autism Project (LEAP): design and methodologies to identify and validate stratification biomarkers for autism spectrum disorders
referenced_paper_title.justification: The LEAP project is referenced along with the title of the referenced paper that elaborates on its methodologies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Data from the European Autism Interventions—A Multicentre Study for Developing New Medications (EU-AIMS) Longitudinal European Autism Project (LEAP) [27] was used…

name.justification: The study used the Statistical Parametric Mapping software (SPM12) for MRI data analysis and preprocessing.
name.quote: T1-weighted MRI data were processed with the Voxel Based Morphometry (VBM) pipeline in the computational anatomy toolbox (CAT12: http://​www.​neuro. ​uni- ​jena. ​de/​cat/) in statistical parametric mapping software (SPM12: Wellcome Department of Imaging Neuroscience, London, UK).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The software is used for processing and not a study on its own, hence not referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: T1-weighted MRI data were processed with the Voxel Based Morphometry (VBM) pipeline in the computational anatomy toolbox (CAT12: http://​www.​neuro. ​uni- ​jena. ​de/​cat/) in statistical parametric mapping software (SPM12: Wellcome Department of Imaging Neuroscience, London, UK).
